title: Arts and Play-Integrated Creative Language Education Design: Strengthening Expression, Reading Comprehension, and Communication Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of an intermediate-level course in a related field or equivalent experience, understanding of foundational language education theories (grammar, vocabulary, reading comprehension, writing), and experience utilizing artistic media
context.additional_context: A teaching competency enhancement course for pre-service or in-service teachers. Focuses on strengthening creative teaching methodology development combining language and arts for practicing elementary school teachers. Centers on improving learnersâ€™ text analysis, writing, and communication (speaking/listening) skills. Emphasizes multimodal expression methods using diverse artistic media (visual arts, theater, digital content).

learning_goals: Learners can enhance their ability to design language expression (writing/speaking) and reading (text analysis) activities using artistic media such as theater and visual arts.

Learners develop at least three language learning scenarios incorporating playful elements such as role-playing and gamification, integrating creative writing, contextual vocabulary, and practical grammar.

Learners create one arts-integrated lesson plan according to project-based assessment criteria (30% creativity, 30% feasibility, 40% educational effectiveness), establish a plan reflecting feedback from at least three peers in a feedback session, and ensure the final lesson plan includes at least two elements each of expressiveness (clear activity descriptions and visual representations) and communication (learner engagement strategies and interaction design).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
